title: Fintech & Digital Transformation

sections.title: The Fintech Revolution
sections.content:
Fintech (Financial Technology) is disrupting traditional banking through agile, customer-centric solutions.

- **Payments & Remittances**: Services like Stripe or Wise that simplify global transactions.
- **Neobanks**: Digital-only banks (e.g., Revolut, Monzo) without physical branches, offering lower fees and better UX.
- **Open Banking**: A system where banks share customer data with third-party providers via **APIs** (Application Programming Interfaces), allowing for more personalized financial products.
- **Lending & Crowdfunding**: P2P (Peer-to-Peer) lending platforms that bypass traditional banks.

sections.title: Blockchain, Crypto & AI
sections.content:
Deep tech is reshaping the infrastructure of finance.

- **Blockchain**: A distributed ledger technology that ensures transparency and security without a central authority.
- **Smart Contracts**: Self-executing contracts with the terms directly written into code.
- **CBDCs (Central Bank Digital Currencies)**: Digital forms of a country's sovereign currency managed by the central bank.
- **AI & Machine Learning**: Used for algorithmic trading, fraud detection, and automated credit scoring.

sections.title: Language Focus: Future in the Past & Certainty
sections.content:
When discussing the evolution of Fintech, we often describe past plans or predictions from a historical perspective.

- **Future in the Past**: 
  - 'We **were going to launch** the app in March, but the regulatory approval was delayed.'
  - 'It **was to become** the first crypto-native bank, but the market crashed.'
- **Expressing Certainty & Doubt**: 
  - 'It is **highly probable** that CBDCs will replace physical cash.'
  - 'There is **every likelihood** that AI will automate most compliance tasks.'
  - 'It is **highly disputed** whether DeFi can truly replace traditional intermediaries.'

objectives: Analyze the impact of Fintech, neobanks, and open banking on the traditional financial sector
Understand the technical and strategic implications of blockchain, smart contracts, and AI
Master linguistic structures for expressing future-in-the-past and degrees of certainty
